sentences.sContent: He was beginning to wonder if he would survive the ordeal.
sentences.sCn: 他开始怀疑自己能否熬过这场磨难。

sentences.sContent: Teresa had a transplant in 1989 and was just recovering from that ordeal when she suffered a brain hemorrhage.
sentences.sCn: 特雷莎在1989年做了一次移植手术，而正当她刚刚从那可怕的磨难中逐渐恢复时，又患了脑溢血。

sentences.sContent: Soon the whole terrifying ordeal would be over.
sentences.sCn: 这场恐怖的磨难很快就会过去的。

synos.tran: 折磨；严酷的考验；痛苦的经验

trans.tranCn: 折磨；严酷的考验；痛苦的经验
trans.tranOther: a terrible or painful experience that continues for a period of time
